text.p: Fakto, Estonia's Nissan dealer which has launched a share issue, had turnover of 31.06 million kroons and net profit of 50,000 kroons in the first quarter, it said on Friday.
It hopes for a net profit of 2.5 million kroons and turnover of 160 million kroons in the whole of 1997.
"The first quarter is sleepy in the car market and car sales started only in mid-March," Toivo Urva, chairman, told Reuters.
The first quarter results were very similar to the figures for the same period in 1996, he added.
Urva said there were 177 Nissan cars sold in Estonia in the first quarter and 110 were sold by Fakto.
The first months are costly because of trade fairs and other expenses to be paid for the whole year, Urva added.
"There will be a quicker rise in the second quarter," he said.
This year Fakto plans to start selling another car brand beside Nissan, Urva said.
"We are negotiating actively...to start selling a car which could sell 300 a year in Estonia," he added.
Fakto has also applied to list its shares on the Tallinn stock exchange secondary list.
It is to issue 444,588 10-kroon shares for a sale price of 28 kroons to raise its equity capital to 14.7 million kroons.
